text:
No you are right the whole RWA/tokenization trend is all pushed by supply side. It is still to be shown wether there is actual end user demand. 

In the mean time tradfi asset issuers are already earning on multi million dollar deals in sold asset  to middlemen (tokenization platforms, chain foundations). They are basically getting paid for the privilege to let some web3 player sell their products. Hard to imagine what will happen to the space if this does not pan out with retail.

Then I am even more confusedâ€¦cause retail is still considered to be dead, no? Also I understand that offchain part could be anything, but distribution part is still on chainâ€¦and even without defillama at some point it would be visible. But may be I am being slow now, got a flight delayed, middle of the night here.
blackrock's "involvement" on defi
There is 0 cost for them on creating a new vehicle (a token) for a distributor to work for them
That's the thing, RWA isn't DeFi â€” its just a way for tradfi to offboard their assets to retail via new distributors (say Ethena, Aave, Sky, etc etc) with a commission on top of that
Not sure about this cause if we were beyond this point, defi would be bigger and no need to inflate RWA numbers
DefiLlama was quoted in Bank for International Settlements report this year  ğŸ˜‚
so being on their platform is having a seal of approval that they can't get anywhere else (similar to what was being on coinmarketcap back in the etherdelta days)
its beyond that point rn, as its being used by many tardfi institutions
Good point ye

What do you think is a purpose of Figure here? Like why they want so badly to be on defillama, even with all the tradfi backings? Like I understand defillama means a high trust score for defi people, but defi is still relatively small. And when it comes to intersection of defi/rwa, if we are talking a few bn tvl somebody would def notice its impact or lack of it anyway.

GLP was strictly programmatic, never was designed to trade against or pick its spots, was willing to take all trades against it within defined parameters. It ensurered traders had defined markets, and LPs were compensated for this.

Ie there was no person, quant etc deciding how to trade and market make that specific market and actively trading it, also liquidation mechanics were quite objective.  

To be clear I think HLP was a legendary product because the HL team realised that the market didn't really car about that transparency if it was generally working 'okay'.  

Different products for different ages, today we are now comfortable with a world of not just actively risk managed vaults, but active traders and curators.
its like on the same quadrant of "nonsense", you can split it between those with money or those without it
This is not HEX tho, these guys actually have big legit businesses (their backers and supporters) so ye itâ€™s more close to XRP
What is MemeCore and why it have 4B mcap and 12B FDV? It's not even on defillama
the externalities of this is better marketing for them (see XRP, HEX, etc etc)
its not like a real person actually uses it

Look:

And every second corpo loaded on their bags and jumping on their dick. They are twisting the perception and what people believe in (using their big $$). The same effect venture had when decent funds started supporting scammy projects - turning everything into lemons

Justified call out, for our Tokenization report we tried to get access to Figure's IBC network or at least get enough permissions to double check rwa.xyz metrics but very little cooperation on their side. More of a "trust us bro metrics"
Referencing https://x.com/0xngmi/status/1966798227870556567?s=40

This tweet, quoted tweets and comments - are a great example of a reality check clash when it comes to where we are heading as an industry. Itâ€™s not even an ethos clash or moral police, but the difference in what & how we accept things to be.

On the one side, endorsements from key people at vaneck_us & BitwiseInvest & others, aka the big money corporates. On the other side, crypto-native people who donâ€™t buy into every vanity metric they see - and like to have a bit more proof than â€œtrust me broâ€.

The outcome is very obvious though: the big money corporates will just recreate the dashboards, metrics, and information - pushing out whatever we deemed to be essential before. Simply because they have more money and more usersâ€¦ and because we all submit to them. 

You can see every fund, GP, founder - join the circus to support one another in these theatres. Because thatâ€™s how you get business and how the game is played.

It is what it is.
